Good morning.  My name is Katherine Nosari, and I represent the defendant in this action.  I'm gonna be taking your deposition today.  Have you ever had your deposition taken before?

text: When I served in a jury.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, this is just gonna be a question-and-answer session on the record.  I'm gonna be asking you questions, and you'll be giving me responses.  Make sure you wait until the interpreter interprets the question completely before you start answering.  We don't want to talk over each other at any point today. There is a court reporter here.  He is writing down everything we say, so just make sure you verbalize all your responses.  You can't shake your head, shrug your shoulders, or say things like "uh-huh," "uh-uh."  Say "yes" or "no" so it's a verbal thing he can hear and write down.

text: Correct.

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you treating with him for any type of issues -- ongoing issues or complaints back when this accident occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What were you being treated with -- for?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: For my blood pressure.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Anything else?  Is that a "no"?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I think I saw in some of the medical records that you had a past medical history of migraines.  Is that accurate?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you -- who treated you for the migraines in the past?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did Dr. Felipe ever treat you?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall the last time you've actually had any treatment for -- like medical treatment prior to this accident occurring?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: For migraines or for anything?
speaker: MR. TIMONEY

text: For migraines.  I'm sorry.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I always had issues with headaches but nothing -- nothing that strong like now.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever have any specific treatment for migraines like you were on specific medication or they did specific therapy or gave you -- sometimes they do injections into the head.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And are you alleging an increase or an aggravation of your migraines from this accident?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how were your migraines made worse?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Well, my head now hurts daily.  And I also get pain in my neck, and that really bothers my neck.  And I also get nauseous.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How often were you getting headaches or migraines prior to this accident occurring?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: My migraines were under control.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So how often did that mean?  How often did you experience them?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: But now -- but now my head hurts a lot more, like almost daily.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But I'm wondering what -- I want to know your baseline, so I'm wondering how it was before the accident, how often.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Well, it would hurt, yes, but it wouldn't last as many hours.  And I would just go and take a painkiller, and it would go away.  Now, I can't even get rid of them with the painkillers.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But again, how many times, let's say a week or a month, however -- if you can approximate, how -- how often you would get a headache prior -- before this accident occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Like two times a week or three times a month.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's -- that's a lot different, two times a week or three times a month.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember.  I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you -- did -- are you -- would you say -- is it your testimony that you were not getting them daily before this accident occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you ever have any nausea when you would have migraines before this accident occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you mentioned you would take pain medication that would relieve your headaches before the accident.  So what were you taking?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Ibuprofen.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Just over the counter?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: It was prescribed.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And do you recall the doctor that prescribed it?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Could -- would it have been your primary care doctor?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Dr. Arias?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Well, then who?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember the name, because he left where I was going.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you remember what kind of doctor he or she was?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: It's in -- I just don't remember the name.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is that something you would be able to look up or have at home or ask someone?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Again, could you find that out and give it to your attorney, and he'll give it to me.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Thank you. All right.  Let's talk about the accident. We talked about the date of the accident.  What -- what time of day did it occur?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember exactly the time.  I know it was in the afternoon, close to like 4:30, 5:00.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where were you coming from?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I was going to?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No.  Where were you coming from at the time of the accident?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I was going to New York.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You were going -- okay.  Were you coming from your home?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where were you going to in New York?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: To visit my sister.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where does she live in New York?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: 611 West 52nd Street, Manhattan.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where did the accident occur?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: On 78.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you driving or were you a passenger?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I was the driver.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what car were you driving?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: A RAV4.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you own that car?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Was.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You did own it?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Correct.  Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How many lanes of travel were in your direction on 78 where the accident occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Two lanes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you in the left or right lane when the accident occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Right.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did the accident occur right like close to an exit, meaning like an on-ramp or an off-ramp to an exit?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: In your own words, could you just describe for me how the accident occurred.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I was on my lane of travel.  And then, he came from the other lane.  And then, all of a sudden, he just came towards my lane and just pushed me over.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so by "the other lane," are you referring to the left lane?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And when you -- so when you first saw my client's vehicle, which lane was it in when you first viewed it?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I didn't see him.  He just kept on.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Let me ask you this way:  Did you see my client's vehicle at all before you felt an impact?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So was the impact your first notice that an accident had occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where on your vehicle was the impact?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: On the driver's side.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where on the driver's side?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Back.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you know what part of my client's car came into contact with your vehicle?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: The front.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where were you looking when you felt the impact?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Driving straight.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So what happened after the impact occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I noticed it was a green van.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Green van?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I think it was green or blue.  It had a color to it.  It had some color to it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So go ahead.  A colored van.  What did you notice about the van?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I didn't notice anything else.  He hit me and took off.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Where -- he went straight in front of you?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And -- and what lane was he in when he was driving away?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: He went on my lane.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The right lane?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so what did you do in response?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I came off.  My husband was dizzy.  And there were people from behind that followed the van.  I called the police, but they also call them.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So there were drivers behind you in a different car that followed the -- the car that hit you?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.  Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did they track that car down?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.  Well, they didn't track him themselves.  They called the police, and the police caught him.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did they -- I guess they got his license plate?  Is that your understanding?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I didn't take it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So after the impact occurred, you stopped your vehicle?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As a result of the actual impact between the two vehicles, was your vehicle pushed in any direction?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You're pointing to your right?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: How far to your right were you pushed?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: About distance, I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you pushed completely out of your lane of travel?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you -- was -- what was to your right, like a shoulder lane, or what was there?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: It was like an empty -- like...
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You said an empty something?  What was there?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Like if I would have gotten pushed a little bit more, I would have gone into the emptiness of it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Okay.  Was there any like barriers on -- on 78?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Not on that part.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As a result of the initial impact, did your vehicle strike or hit anything else?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And how far did you travel until you were able to bring your car to a stop?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Well, when the police arrived, he told me that he was going to drive ahead of me because they had been able to detain the man.  It was like a -- by a gas station like right across from Dorney Park.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you pulled your vehicle over into a gas station?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so how far away was that gas station from where the impact occurred?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Could you see the gas station if you were -- if you were in the area where the accident occurred, can you see the gas station?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you originally stop your car on 78 and then drive to the gas station, or did you continuously drive, since you felt the impact, to the gas station?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.  I stopped.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then you drove later to the gas station?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so that -- is that where the police met you, in the gas station?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.  The policeman met me at the accident.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then he drove in front of you to the gas station?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you, at any point, ever have a conversation with my client, either at the scene or at any point afterwards?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What did the police -- did the police tell you anything about my client's car, my client, speaking with my client?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So was it just one police officer that came?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did any other emergency vehicles come to the scene or to the gas station?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: As a result of the impact, did any part of your body strike anything inside the car?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: With the steering wheel.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What did you -- what part of your body hit the steering wheel?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: My head, my shoulder.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Which shoulder?  Right.  So your right shoulder and your head?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you bleeding at all at the scene?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any cuts or scrapes?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever have any bruising afterwards?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were you in any pain while you were at the scene or at the gas station with the police?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you have any trouble driving your car -- like mechanically with the car, did you have any trouble driving it to the police station (sic)?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Well, the car was a little shaky.  And I was also frightened.  But the policeman told me, "Let's just go your pace," and we just went there.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was your car towed or did you drive it home?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.  I went in my car.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you were able to drive your car from the scene?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you end up going home from there, or did you go to New York?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: We went back.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Home?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Home.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What happened to the car?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: We waited for the insurance.  The insurance came. They said it was complete loss, and they took it.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you ever speak with the drivers of the vehicle behind you that -- that followed the car that hit you?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you speak with anyone -- other than speaking with the police officer and possibly your husband, did you speak with anyone else at the scene or at the gas station about the accident?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was your husband complaining of any pain or discomfort?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was he complaining of?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: That his arm hurt and that he was dizzy.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you lifted your left arm?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: He had his arm on top of me, like behind the seat, so the left one.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So when the accident occurred, it's your testimony he had his arm over -- on your seat?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.  Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So he was complaining of left arm pain and -- and you said dizziness?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did he have any ambulance come to the scene for him?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.  We didn't want to.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: All right.  When did you first start to experience pain or discomfort?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: We went to the hospital on Sunday.  We went to the hospital on Sunday because he didn't -- he didn't sleep.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So the accident happened on Saturday?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did you get checked out at the hospital?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What was bothering you at that time?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: My arm, my shoulder.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Which arm and which shoulder?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: The right one.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where on your arm?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: The arm is the whole arm, and the shoulder is here.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you -- you were kind of pointing like up towards your neck?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you were feeling pain on the right side of the neck and into the shoulder and down the arm?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Were -- was the pain going down to your fingers or hand at all?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.  When I wake up, my hand is asleep.  This finger, it straightens out like this.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You're pointing to your middle finger?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And were you -- you were having that complaint into your fingers at the hospital the next day, or did that develop later on?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: It would hurt me, but I didn't mention anything in the hospital.  I figured it was just due to the impact.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did they do for you at the hospital?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I think that they took x-rays.  X-rays.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And did they go over the results of the testing with you?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You had no understanding of the results of your testing at the ER?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did they give you any medication?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you were just there -- you were treated and released that day, correctly -- correct?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then, where did you next receive medical treatment?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: They send me to therapy.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The hospital did?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: I have that there were some record of treatment, therapy done at Berks Orthopedic?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yeah.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And had you ever -- is that who you treated with for the knee?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: That's somewhere different, okay.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: You want to take a break?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yeah.  Let's take a break.
speaker: MR. TIMONEY

text: Sure.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: (Recess was taken from 11:37 a.m. to 11:44 a.m.)
So who referred you to Berks County Orthopedic?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But you had not treated there before this accident?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.  I think a girlfriend told me about that place.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And you received therapy there, correct?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And so what -- when, you know, therapy started, when you started treating there, what was bothering you?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: My neck, my arm would bother me, and -- and sometimes the back.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Is this the low back or middle back?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: The mid, low.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Both the mid and low?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: So you were having the right-sided neck pain into the right arm; is that correct?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then, you were having mid and low back pain?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then, earlier, you told me you had an aggravation of your right knee arthritis.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.  But that -- that is something separate. That's separate from this, the arthritis.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: No.  I understand.  But I believe your testimony earlier was that you had, I guess, an aggravation of that right knee pain from the arthritis in this accident.  Is that still correct?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And -- and by "aggravation," what do you mean?  How is it aggravated?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: That it has hurt me more.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The pain -- the -- the severity of the pain has increased?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Any other way it was aggravated?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And then, you also mentioned the increase in migraines.
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Does that cover all the pain or discomfort in your body and the injuries you're alleging after this accident?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And was the therapy you received helpful?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: If it was helpful?
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Yeah.  Like did it help relieve your pain?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: It would relieve me while I was receiving it, but the following day, it was the same way.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what other treatment at Berks Orthopedic were you -- were you getting?  Anything else?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I would get electric.  I would get exercises.  And they would place me on the machine with my hands.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When you went there for therapy, how long would your treatment last?  How long were you there for?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: How long?  Like six months.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Six months in total.  But when you went there, like how long were you there for each day?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Three days.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Three times a week?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: But each visit, when you would get there, how long would it take to do your therapy?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Twenty, twenty-five minutes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And were you getting any medication prescribed?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And I have that you treated with a -- a neurological doctor.  Do you recall that, Dr. Ratner?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And what did he do for you?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: What I remember what they did to me, I think they only did the test.  I don't know.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: What kind of test?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Well, I don't know if the name is right about the doctor who gave me an injection.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: When did you get an injection?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember the date.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: And where was the injection to?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: On the shoulder.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: The right shoulder?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: You just don't know the doctor that did it?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: The doctor is there on the paperwork, but I don't remember.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it at Berks Ortho?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Do you recall where you went for the injection?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I went to West Reading.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it a male or a female that performed the injection?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Man.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Could it have been Dr. Ratner?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: I don't remember the name.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Who referred you to that doctor to get the injection?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: The orthopedic from the therapy.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Did you only get one injection?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.
speaker: THE WITNESS

text: Was it helpful?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Four days.

text: For a few days?
speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: Yes.

speaker: MS. NOSARI

text: No.

speaker: MS. NOSARI
